originalText.text:
I wish I could give negative stars.  We were verbally harassed and abused by a bus driver named Barbara Miller going from State College to NYC.  I'm posting this on literally any forum I can to warn people about this horrific person & company.

I have never in my life experienced a person as hateful and berating as her.  She made it her mission to project her bad attitude onto everyone on the bus by screaming demeaning comments and bullying patrons for simply trying to board the bus.  It is genuinely scary that someone with her temperament is allowed to drive a bus full of people. She in no way is a qualified person to be handling people's lives.

I have rode the Megabus many, many times, I'm not new to the guidelines.  She decided that she had a different set of rules and violently screamed at everyone for not following them precisely- resulting in her kicking 2 of us off the bus.  We apologized for not being aware of her rules many times, still insisted we were not allowed to ride.  She stalled the bus for over an hour, left patrons on the bus in the hot sun with no air, shut me in the bus door and continually refused to explain any of her decisions/actions.  She refused to contact her management to back up her actions and continuously harassed us.

I'm genuinely writing this to warn people about how terrifying this was.  It was honestly traumatic and I've never seen an adult conduct themselves that way.  And on top of that, the company itself doesn't take any responsibility or try to protect customers.  I sincerely hope you don't ever have to encounter Barbara Miller from Pittsburgh, PA as your driver!

originalText.text: I bought tickets SWF > NYC before getting to my bus. Got to airport, staff members approached me asking if I was taking mega bus. was told once I got to the driver that my reservation number, which was the only thing provided to me, was invalid. So I bought new tickets. Got the same reservation number with no tickets. So I had to pay cash. Now mega bus is telling me I got on a different bus, not a mega bus. This was the only bus at the airport at the time. I am out $100 for something that should have been $25 and ended up having to dispute it on my card since mega bus wants to deny deny deny everything. A literal scam of a company.

A literal scam of a company.

originalText.text:
My NYC to Boston at 3:30pm was cancelled due to "operational issues". I got to reschedule for free at the next available time(6:30PM). The 6:30 bus was a no show. 30mins later we all got a email saying bus is delayed due to "mechanical issues". ETA is 60 to 90 mins which was bull since the bus didn't show up til 9:18PM. It was due to "traffic". Mind you 2 other M22 bus's arrived from Boston during this time frame but they apparently wasn't going back to Boston and we needed to wait for that specific M22 bus that had mechanical issue and was stuck in traffic.

I booked a round trip so my bus from Boston to NYC was ALSO LATE but just by 40mins which isnt as bad as my 6 hour NYC to Boston bus.

originalText.text: Booked a bus to New York Stewart airport for 2.45pm on Jan 1st. The bus was full and there were no seats available. 8 customers with tickets were unable to travel. the driver sent us on a wild goose chase to the ticket office on the 4th floor to get us out of the way whilst he made a quick exit. The driver told us he had not checked if the people on the bus had tickets, so it was likely that ticketed customers were unable to get on the bus due to customers without tickets on the bus. We were all trying to make an international flight from Stewart and had to find alternative transportation. We shared a cab with another couple in the same situation and paid $250 to get to Stewart in addition to the $47.99 for the tickets we could not use. The people at the office  were worse than useless and didn't want to know.

originalText.text:
I may be scorned for the 4-star rating but Megabus did the job during our first (and so far only) trip with them. We traveled from DC to NYC at the start of spring and paid extra for front seats at the second level, so we can enjoy the view. Boarding was prompt and the bus left on time. Initially, it was warm and stuffy where we were seated but it became comfortable as soon as temp control kicked in. The ride was mostly smooth and I could tell the driver was driving more carefully along the more congested and accident prone sections of the route. There were no stops and traffic wasn't terrible so we arrived in NYC just a few minutes behind schedule. There is indeed a certain nasty smell coming from the toilet, but it does go away after the toilet door is closed.

We are inclined to try them again based on this experience.
